name: adios

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: shared
variants.description: Builds a shared version of the library

variants.name: hdf5
variants.description: Enable parallel HDF5 transport and serial bp2h5 converter

variants.name: staging
variants.description: Enable dataspaces and/or flexpath staging transports

description:
The Adaptable IO System (ADIOS) provides a simple, flexible way for
scientists to describe the data in their code that may need to be
written, read, or processed outside of the running simulation.

dependencies.name: autoconf
dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools

dependencies.name: automake
dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools

dependencies.name: bzip2
dependencies.description:
bzip2 is a freely available, patent free high-quality data compressor.
It typically compresses files to within 10% to 15% of the best available
techniques (the PPM family of statistical compressors), whilst being
around twice as fast at compression and six times faster at
decompression.

dependencies.name: c-blosc
dependencies.description: Blosc, an extremely fast, multi-threaded, meta-compressor library

dependencies.name: dataspaces
dependencies.description: an extreme scale data management framework.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: hdf5
dependencies.description:
HDF5 is a data model, library, and file format for storing and managing
data. It supports an unlimited variety of datatypes, and is designed for
flexible and efficient I/O and for high volume and complex data.

dependencies.name: libevpath
dependencies.description:
EVpath is an event transport middleware layer designed to allow for the
easy implementation of overlay networks, with active data processing,
routing and management at all points in the overlay. EVPath is designed
for high performance systems.

dependencies.name: libtool
dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.

dependencies.name: lz4
dependencies.description:
LZ4 is lossless compression algorithm, providing compression speed at
400 MB/s per core, scalable with multi-cores CPU. It also features an
extremely fast decoder, with speed in multiple GB/s per core, typically
reaching RAM speed limits on multi-core systems.

dependencies.name: m4
dependencies.description: GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor.

dependencies.name: mpi
dependencies.description: Cray/HPE packaging of MVAPICH2 for HPE Apollo systems

dependencies.name: netcdf-c
dependencies.description:
NetCDF (network Common Data Form) is a set of software libraries and
machine-independent data formats that support the creation, access, and
sharing of array-oriented scientific data. This is the C distribution.

dependencies.name: sz
dependencies.description: Error-bounded Lossy Compressor for HPC Data

dependencies.name: szip
dependencies.description:
Szip is an implementation of the extended-Rice lossless compression
algorithm. It provides lossless compression of scientific data, and is
provided with HDF software products.

dependencies.name: zfp
dependencies.description:
zfp is a compressed number format for multidimensional floating-point
and integer arrays. zfp provides compressed-array classes that support
high throughput read and write random access to individual array
elements. zfp also supports serial and parallel (OpenMP and CUDA)
compression of whole arrays.

dependencies.name: zlib-api
dependencies.description: zlib replacement with optimizations for next generation systems.

dependent_to.name: savanna
dependent_to.description:
CODARcode Savanna runtime framework for high performance, workflow
management using Swift/T and ADIOS.

dependent_to.name: openpmd-api
dependent_to.description: C++ & Python API for Scientific I/O

dependent_to.name: conduit
dependent_to.description:
Conduit is an open source project from Lawrence Livermore National
Laboratory that provides an intuitive model for describing hierarchical
scientific data in C++, C, Fortran, and Python. It is used for data
coupling between packages in-core, serialization, and I/O tasks.
